ai.question: What is used to identify the path to the next frame-relay switch in a Frame Relay network?

choice.text: CIR
DLCI
FECN
BECN

ai.question: Why are Frame Relay paths referred to as virtual?

choice.text: There are no dedicated circuits to and from the Frame Relay carrier.
Frame Relay PVCs are created and discarded on demand.
The connections between PVC endpoints act like dialup circuits.
There are no dedicated circuits inside the Frame Relay carrier cloud.

ai.question: Which statement accurately describes the split horizon problem with regard to a multipoint topology?

choice.text: Split horizon must be disabled for all non-IP protocols.
Split horizon creates IP routing loops in multipoint domains.
Split horizon does not apply to broadcasts, so it does not protect protocols that use broadcast updates.
Split horizon prevents any point from accepting a valid update and forwarding to all the other points.

ai.question: What are two reasons Frame Relay is more cost-effective than leased lines? (Choose two.)

choice.text: time division multiplexing
uses less equipment
optimized packet routing
shares bandwidth across a large customer base
dynamic IP addressing

form-item.ai: The DLCI is programmed in the Frame Relay switch, but the other end of the PVC may be down.The DLCI does not exist on the router.The DLCI is programmed in the switch and is usable.The DLCI does not exist on the Frame Relay switch for this router. The DLCI is programmed on the other end of the PVC for this router. ActiveInactiveDeleted Match the status of a DLCI from the show frame-relay pvc command with its meaning.123no titleno description given31411 Active - DLCI is programmed in the frame-relay switch and useable. 2. Inactive - DLCI is programmed in the switch but for some reason it is not usable 3. - Deleted - The DLCI does not exist on the frame relay switch for this router.

ai.question: What reliability advantage does Frame Relay offer over leased lines?

choice.text: Frame Relay access circuits are higher grade circuits than leased lines.
The pathways for virtual circuits inside the carrier are meshed.
From end to end, a single virtual circuit uses a fixed error-checked path.
Frame Relay uses more sophisticated error detection methods.

ai.question: Refer to the exhibit. What is placed in the address field of a frame that will travel from the Orlando office to the DC office?

choice.text: MAC address of the Orlando router
MAC address of the DC router
DLCI 100
DLCI 200

ai.question: Which situation favors a multipoint topology over point-to-point?

choice.text: when VLSM cannot be used to conserve addresses
when using routing protocols other than IP
when using a frame mesh topology to save access circuits
when using a routing protocol that requires broadcast updates

ai.question: What is an advantage of configuring subinterfaces in a Frame Relay environment?

choice.text: makes the DLCIs globally significant
eliminates the need for using Inverse ARP
reduces split horizon issues
improves flow control and bandwidth usage

ai.question: Which protocol can provide error correction for data that is transmitted over a Frame Relay link?

choice.text: FECN
FTP
LMI
TCP
UDP

form-item.ai: show interfaceshow frame-relay lmishow frame-relay pvcshow frame-relay mapdebug frame-relay lmi view the status of the virtual circuit and FECN/BECN statisticsverify that the router and Frame Relay switch are sending and receiving LMI packets properly verify encapsulation, LMI type, LMI DLCI, and LMI statusverify LMI statisticsverify the IP address associated with a DLCI Drag the commands on the left to the description on the right.12345no titleno description given351241show interface verify encapsulation, LMI type, LMI DLCI, LMI status show frame-relay lmi verify LMI statistics show frame-relay pvc verify view the status of the virtual circuit and FECN/BECN statistics show frame-relay map verify the IP address associated with a DLCI debug frame-relay lmi verify the router and frame relay switch are sending and receiving lmi packets properly

ai.question: At which rate does a service provider guarantee to transfer data into the Frame Relay network?

choice.text: baud rate
timing rate
data transfer rate
committed information rate
They are assigned by a DLCI server.
They are assigned arbitrarily by the user.
They are assigned by the service provider.
They are assigned based on the host IP address.

ai.question: A router can reach multiple networks through a Frame Relay interface. How does the router know which DLCI to assign to the IP address of the destination network?

choice.text: It consults the Frame Relay map.
It consults the routing table to find the DLCI.
It uses Frame Relay switching tables to map DLCIs to IP addresses.
It uses RARP to find the IP address of the corresponding DLCI.
